title: What are schools of philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: tructuralism who: Titchener, aspects based on Wundt (1890s) what: psychology's task is to break down/analyze consciousness into its basic elements (vision, hearing, touch) and investigate how these elements are related. Depended on introspection: systematic observation of one's conscious experience. why: One of the original schools brought to America, focused on the individual fundamental components of consciousness, part of one of the first debates in psychology. Functionalism who: american William James, Cattell, Dewey what: -Psychology should focus on the function/purpose of consciousness, not its structure. -Influenced by Darwin's for complete answer click here: SCHOOLS OF PHILOSOPHY

Starting with the Anciety Greeks, following the Socratic School, is Idealism, Realism, Neocholasticism, Humanism, then 20th century philosophies, Pragmatism, Existentialism, Phenomenology, Positivism (Logical Positivism) and the quasi-philosophy of Post-Modernism. In between these are many less notable but yet interesting off shoots, like neo-Platonism, This is my list, another might be different.
